e4: Changing to the new policy enhances transparency and aligns reported figures with true earnings, thus promoting fair and honest communication with investors. It also minimizes legal risks associated with biased reporting and fosters long-term trust with investors. Though it may cause short-term confusion, clear communication and gradual adaptation will mitigate impacts on investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring that financial disclosures reflect the true financial performance of the company. It should allow all investors, regardless of their sophistication level, equal access to clear and understandable information. The policy should also aim to comply fully with legal and regulatory standards, thereby minimizing risks and fostering long-term trust with stakeholders.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the change in policy to investors to minimize confusion, what strategies they will use to support retail investors in understanding the implications, and what measures they will take to ensure a smooth transition to unbiased reporting.
